Hero.title: Advancing High Energy Physics at UCN
Hero.subtitle: Weekly talks, discussions, and paper reading sessions fostering collaboration in particle physics.

About.title: A Journal Club for High Energy Physics at UCN
About.desc: A community space at Universidad Católica del Norte to read, present, and discuss research papers in particle physics, cosmology, and related fields. We aim to build a friendly environment for learning, asking questions, and strengthening research culture through regular sessions.

f1.title: Paper-driven discussions
f1.text: Each session focuses on a research paper, with a short introduction and guided discussion to extract the main ideas.

f2.title: Student-friendly environment
f2.text: Open questions are encouraged. The goal is to learn together and build confidence reading advanced literature.

f3.title: Broad HEP scope
f3.text: Topics include particle physics, neutrinos, cosmology, astroparticles, theory/phenomenology, and related tools.

Calendar.oldSubtitle: A brief visual archive of previous meetings and discussions.

Join.title: Join
Join.desc: Want to present a paper or attend sessions? Contact us.

contact.title: Contact
contact.note: For questions, talk proposals, and collaboration.

Footer.disclaimer: Academic initiative for reading and discussion. Not an official university channel.

Join.title: Join
Join.text: There are two ways to participate in the Journal Club: (1) present a talk/paper, or (2) join the group and attend our regular meetings.
Join.b1: Present a talk: propose a paper or a short research update (title + 3–5 lines of context).
Join.b2: Join the group: receive announcements, meeting links/rooms, and participate in discussions.
Join.b3: Students and researchers are welcome — no prior expertise required.
Join.note: When writing, tell us which option you prefer: Present a talk or Join the group. This helps us respond faster.

Team.title: Team
Team.headSub: Faculty coordination and academic guidance for the group.
Team.membersSub: PhD, MSc, and Bachelor students supporting weekly sessions and logistics.
